title: What are the best road trip music albums? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think that instead of naming a best album, it’s better to name a best type of album. For example, I wouldn’t want to listen to new age music - might put me to sleep if I was on a long, straight highway. And hard rock - well, I’d probably blast it and have ringing in my ears when I arrived at my destination. And complex progressive rock - I’d be so focused on the music (trying to figure out the time signatures) that I’d forget I was driving. So I’d vote for middle-of-the-road pop or rock. Just enough energy to keep me alert to my surroundings and somewhat engaged with the music. Maybe with sing-along opportunities. Early-to-mid-career Beatles, Tom Petty, ELO Fleetwood Mac … you get the picture.

Dancing With Your Ghost - - Sasha Sloan  Why Can’t I Have You - - Gloria Laing  Robin Hood - - Anson Seabra  Collapsed - - Natalie Taylor  God Knows I Tried - - Lana Del Rey  King - - Lauren Aquilina  Clean Eyes - - SYML  This Town - - Kygo | Sasha Sloan  If You Go Away -- Helen Merrill & Stan Getz  Six Feet Under - - Billie Eilish  Stay Awake - - Dean Lewis  Apocalypse - - Cigarettes After Sex  Waves Acoustic - Dean Lewis
